radiographic_examinations.findings: The liver is normal in size, echogenicity, and architecture. There is no focal liver lesion. The main portal vein is patent and displays hepatopetal flow. The gallbladder wall is edematous and there is a wall echo shadow sign indicating it is filled with stones. There is no intra- or extra-hepatic biliary ductal dilatation and the common bile duct measures 4 mm. The visualized pancreas is normal.
